intro: Euphrasia odontites var. verna, commonly known as the spring toothwort, is a herbaceous perennial belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a distinctive toothed margin, contributing to its common name. The species is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
